page.title: 20STALLEN, NEAR SHERBORNE
page.content:
This is a small hamlet about 1 mile south-east of Nether Compton. It once belonged to the Abbey but was later granted to Sir John Horsey. The Black Death came from China to Weymouth and spread all over England killing half of the population. One of the villages struck was Stallen. The victims were buried in a common grave near to the old church. One of the farmers, who has lived in Stallen for 15 years, produces dairy replacements for other farmers. Stallen has not changed much over the years. There are only 20 people living there now so it is a very quiet place.
{ Survey material collected by { members of the Fourth year, { St Aldhelm's School, Sherborne.
